articles.author: Gram Slattery, Pesha Magid, Andrew Mills
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump was set to meet Syria's president in Saudi Arabia on Wednesday following a surprise announcement that the United States would lift all sanctions on the Islamist-led government despite lingering concerns about its leaders' former ties to Al Qaeda.
articles.title: Trump to meet Syrian president in Saudi before heading to Qatar

articles.author: Dmitry Antonov, Andrew Osborn
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump and his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin were still "maybes" for what could be the first direct peace talks between Moscow and Kyiv in years after the Kremlin on Wednesday held off disclosing who would represent Russia.
articles.title: Putin and Trump still 'maybes' for Ukraine peace talks that Russian leader proposed

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli military strikes killed at least 50 Palestinians across the Gaza Strip on Wednesday, local health authorities said, in a significant escalation of the bombardment as U.S. President Donald Trump continued his visit to the Middle East.
articles.title: Israeli intensifies Gaza bombardment as Trump visits region

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Al Qaeda affiliate JNIM has claimed responsibility for an attack targeting a military post in Burkina Faso's northern Loroum province in which the group said 60 soldiers were killed, the SITE Intelligence Group said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Al Qaeda affiliate claims responsibility for Burkina attack, says it killed 60 soldiers

articles.author: Alexandra Valencia
articles.description: Ecuador's national assembly legislature on Wednesday elected Niels Olsen - a close ally of President Daniel Noboa - as its new body president, ensuring, for now, a majority for Noboa as he pushes anti-crime and economic reforms.
articles.title: Ecuador assembly elects Noboa ally as leader

articles.author: Asif Shahzad, Gibran Peshimam, Shivam Patel
articles.description: Modi warned Pakistan that New Delhi would target 'terrorist hideouts' again if there were new attacks.
articles.title: Pakistan says it is committed to truce with India, vows response to aggression

articles.author: Alvise Armellini
articles.description: Pope Leo XIV, the first American to head the global Catholic Church, pledged on Wednesday to make "every effort" for peace and offered the Vatican as a mediator in global conflicts, saying war was "never inevitable".
articles.title: Pope Leo says he will make 'every effort' for world peace

articles.author: Karin Strohecker, Libby George, Marc Jones
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump has said he will lift long-standing sanctions on Syria that severed the country from the global financial system under toppled former President Bashar al-Assad.
articles.title: Explainer: Syria's economy: The devastating impact of war and sanctions
